definition: will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: Zhang Yiwu, professor of Chinese literature at Peking University, distinguishes youth from adolescence.
sentences.chinese: 北京大學中文系教授張頤武將青春和青春期區分開來。

sentences.english: Lack of food will stunt children's growth.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏是武將阻礙兒童的成長。

sentences.english: Although he was a military general, he was fond of reading.
sentences.chinese: 趙匡胤雖是一員武將，卻很喜愛讀書，常手不釋卷。

sentences.english: Sun Wu organized the young ladies into two teams and appointed two of the king's favorite concubines team leaders.
sentences.chinese: 孫武將宮女分爲兩隊，叫吳王的兩個寵姬擔任隊長。

sentences.english: The military commander aspect also only then five tiger generals, at most again add Wei Yan and Li are strict.
sentences.chinese: 武將方面也只有五虎上將，頂多再加一個魏延和李嚴。

sentences.english: He is a well known actor, especially good in martial roles.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位名演員，扮演武將尤其出色。

sentences.english: Experience of fierce general biographies is rich and generous, still can cooperate " end knife " piece multiple award.
sentences.chinese: 武將列傳經驗豐厚，還能配合“尾刀”出多倍獎勵。

definition: commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
Liu Bei's five great generals in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, namely: Guan Yu 關羽|关羽, Zhang Fei 張飛|张飞, Zhao Yun 趙雲|赵云, Ma Chao 馬超|马超, Huang Zhong 黃忠|黄忠

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
Xiang Yu the Conqueror (232-202 BC), warlord defeated by first Han emperor
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
the Saint of War (i.e. the deified Guan Yu 關羽|关羽[Guan1 Yu3])

Lü Buwei (?291-235 BC), merchant and politician of the State of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], subsequent Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor, allegedly the father of Ying Zheng 嬴政[Ying2 Zheng4], who subsequently became the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
